snippet: Chinese households have an overwhelming share of their assets in their homes, and any slump in prices could lead to widespread anger, findings say.
abstract: Data from broad survey of household finances in China says Chinese households have overwhelming share of their assets in their homes, meaning any slump in prices could lead to widespread public anger and could hurt families; Southwestern University of Finance and Economics in Chengdu conducted survey.
lead_paragraph: Chinese households have an overwhelming share of their assets in their homes, and any slump in prices could lead to widespread anger, findings say.

headline.main: Home Prices in China May Hurt Families
headline.print_headline: Home Prices in China May Hurt Families
